snippet: Traders, admittedly unsure at times, know their decisions can have an outsize effect on economic policy.
abstract: Europe's bond market has emerged as a significant player in continent's economic crisis, representing a seminal shift in power from politicians to investors and a relatively obscure cohort of bankers; bond traders themselves confess to a level of uncertainty about daily decisions that have an outsized effect on euro zone government debt and economic policy.
lead_paragraph: Traders, admittedly unsure at times, know their decisions can have an outsize effect on economic policy.

headline.seo: Bond Traders Deal in High Expectations, and Fear
headline.main: Bond Traders in Europe Deal in High Expectations, and Fear
headline.print_headline: Bond Traders in Europe Deal in High Expectations, and Fear
